column2: willie, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: do not take this pill it is not worth it it cost 6300 dollars a month it caused me not  to be able to go out in the sun for very long it feals like fiberglass iching spells  from head to toe

column2: Dorothy, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: It seems as if I am breathing a little better . I seem to have regressed after taking 125mg. for a year and 1/2 now. At first I fainted while walking around my yard and had like little head rushes. I had had some nausea. And mush joint pain all over. I feel like I am trading one problem for many others. Overall what R U going to do...........Sure wish there was a better resolution to this disease.... :)

column2: Lee Ann , 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have been on med for second time. First time med was started day one out of hospital after open lung biopsy.  My chest tube site started to drain profusely.  I stopped med.  Chest tube site now infected but not leaking.  Started med again, day 3 and Im so full of fluid.  Call into dr office.

column2: sjn, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
Carol, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: This medication has allowed increased stamina, and allows me to feel the energy I had before PAH

column2: hopemartelladavi@aol.com, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am in my third month. I am taking 125 mgs.Started at 62.5  mgs. I have been on oxygen for 12 yrs. Am  now at 6 liters - 24/7. I'm in my third year of Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension. I believe the medication has helped me. I can walk more and longer. I've had headaches, flushing, fever like feelings, coughing, sinus like problems. I  have my liver tested every month,so far so good. I also have asthma and am on allergy shots. Some of my problems could be related to the asthma. Over all I beleive this medication will prolong my life span.

column2: acain, 25-34 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on this medication for about 5 going on 6 months now in the first month i had headaches but they stopped. about half way thru the second month i started getting head rushes every time i stood up and if going from sitting on the floor to standing i would have to do it in stages or i would have fainted however this has now also stopped.  Was reading another post that mentioned heartburn...I too have been getting way more heartburn then before and also a lot more gas causing burps. The pills seemed to be doing more for my breathing in the the first 2 or 3 months and i feel as though they have lost some effectiveness however i could have just forgotten how much worse my breathing really was before am still hopeful for a bit more improvement of symptoms as the Doc said it may take up to 8+ months for full effectiveness of this treatment. overall i have to say its has made activities easier to accomplish.

column2: lovinggranny, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: not sure if related to medication but this person has had pancreatitis twice so far less than 3 months apart.Does anyone know of this problem with tracleer? 3 yrs.of age and not sure if it's even helping the pulmonary hypertension.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
katybeth, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Headacheas are terribble and my back is killing me..

column2: Diane, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I did not want to take this medication because I did not feel I was that bad and I did not like the side effects.  My doctors convinced me I needed to take it.  After about two months, I feel much stronger over all, and I do not get short of breath as quickly.  I can do things it was very hard to do before.

column2: Lou, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Within a year I felt 100% better

column2: georgia, 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am having a lot of headaches, throat irration, coughing but I am walking better and able to stand without feeling like I am going to faint.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on tracleer for 90 days my last liver function test came back abnormal will repeat it.

column2: Nicole, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Hi there.. I was diagnosed with Primary Pulmonary Hypertension in 2006. I am 22.  Side effects: Weight gain, but im back to normal. Overall: Lowered pressures in lungs, right side of heart back to normal size, rarely get chest pains, Slowed down leakage of valve. Still on medication but It saved my life!

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: easy to take and so far no side effects

column2: Tom, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Have been on Tracleer for 6 months, since initial diagnosis.  Am on oxygen 24/7, which is awkward and uncomfortable.  Have had no good effects from Tracleer - it could be progression of disease but I have gotten progressively worse.  Not a lot of side effects and liver tests are good.  Have some new joint pain but not sure if it is a side effect.  Overall very disappointed in results.

column2: 75 or over on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had most of the side effects noted. Had to stop after the start of the second month. Had weakness in hands and knees and unable to motivate.

column2: 65-74 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Caregiver)
column9: decrease in platlets

column2: freeagain, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I thought it was helping me alittle until I stopped taking it and now I can breath and walk and am not blue.  I feel great now that I take only diaretics, vitimins and subliments, and healthy eathing. Oh yeah.... and getting rid of all negative people in my life.

column2: tshuman, 35-44 on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)

column2: rose, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: Have been using it for 2-3 years now (2008) Benefits were slow in manifesting themselves however they did appear at 8 to 10 months into the programbetter breathing (exercize tolerance) more adequate profusion and general feel better. costs are high but worth it at this time

column2: yfde, 25-34 Male  (Patient)
column9: i almost died

column2: kelli, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: have been on tracleer since early 2004 and have had no problems with or from it.  i was put on tracleer after being on flolan since feb 1998 when diagnosed with Primary Pulmonary Hypertension.  it is a lot easier to take just two pills a day instead of having a 24 hour pump that you have to carry around.  my pressures have been normal since put on flolan and have been healthy ever since.  i'm hoping to be slowly taken off tracleer by my doctors soon.  i hope to get taken off so i may get  pregnant in the near future.
